H0.text: In 1956, which peninsula was the first part of Britain to be designated an 'Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty'. Cornwall

H1.text: In 1956, which peninsula was the first part of Britain to be designated an 'Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty'. Kintyre

H2.text: In 1956, which peninsula was the first part of Britain to be designated an 'Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty'. Manhood

H3.text: In 1956, which peninsula was the first part of Britain to be designated an 'Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty'. Gwyr

A4.text: In 1956, the majority of Gower became the first area in the United Kingdom to be designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.
